an5.195:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
an5.195:4.2: Now at that time five hundred Licchavis were visiting the Buddha.
an5.195:4.3: Some of the Licchavis were in blue, of blue color, clad in blue, adorned with blue. And some were similarly colored in yellow, red, or white.
an5.195:4.4: But the Buddha outshone them all in beauty and glory.
an5.195:5.1: Then the brahmin Piṅgīyānī got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his cupped palms toward the Buddha, and said:
an5.195:5.2: “I feel inspired to speak, Blessed One! I feel inspired to speak, Holy One!”
an5.195:5.3: “Then speak as you feel inspired,” said the Buddha.
an5.195:5.4: Then the brahmin Piṅgīyānī extolled the Buddha in his presence with an appropriate verse.

an5.195:6.4: bright as the sun in the sky!”
an5.195:7.1: Then those Licchavis presented Piṅgiyānī with five hundred upper robes.
an5.195:7.2: And Piṅgiyānī presented them all to the Buddha.
an5.195:8.1: Then the Buddha said to the Licchavis:
an5.195:8.2: “Licchavis, the appearance of five treasures is rare in the world.
an5.195:8.4: A Realized One, a Perfect One, a fully awakened Buddha.
an5.195:8.5: A person who explains the teaching and training announced by a Realized One.
an5.195:8.6: A person who understands the teaching and training announced by a Realized One.
an5.195:8.7: A person who practises in line with the teaching.
an5.195:8.8: A person who is grateful and thankful.
an5.195:8.9: The appearance of these five treasures is rare in the world.”
